info.title: PortFlow Clearing Agent API
info.description: AI-powered digital clearing agent for Lagos ports

post.description:
Upload a Bill of Lading document to initiate the clearance workflow.

This endpoint:
1. Accepts a PDF file containing the Bill of Lading
2. Extracts container information using OCR/text parsing
3. Creates a new container record in the database
4. Returns the container ID for tracking

get.description:
Get the current status and complete information for a container.

This is the primary endpoint for checking container progress through the clearance workflow.

List all containers, optionally filtered by status.

Query parameters:
- status: Filter by overall_status (e.g., PENDING_VALIDATION, CUSTOMS_CLEARED)
- limit: Maximum number of results (default: 100)

post.description:
Validate a container's documentation and data.

This endpoint performs business logic validation and updates the container status.
The AI agent should call this after a document is uploaded.

get.description:
Check the customs clearance status for a container.

This endpoint simulates querying the Nigerian Customs Service system.
The agent should call this to determine if customs duties are owed.

post.description:
Process customs duty payment for a container.

The agent should call this endpoint after informing the user of the amount due
and receiving confirmation to proceed with payment.

get.description:
Check the shipping/vessel status for a container.

This endpoint simulates querying the Nigerian Ports Authority (NPA) system.

post.description:
Schedule a physical inspection with the Nigerian Ports Authority.

The agent should call this after customs clearance to arrange inspection.

Mark an inspection as completed.

This is a utility endpoint for demo purposes.

Release a container for pickup after all clearances are complete.

The agent should call this after inspection passes.

LogEntrySchema.description: Schema for individual log entries in the container workflow
LogEntrySchema.title: LogEntrySchema
